millsfield:images_texts:
PAA
Know All Ye By These Presents That:
EVELYN RACHEL DAVID
having been borne on the wings of a Clipper of the
PAN AMERICAN WORLD AIRWAYS
across the Equator on 6/7/19
has been accepted into the
Empyrean Realm
of His Exalted Majesty Jupiter Rex.
Freiven Vo El Had and Seal
CLIPPER CAPTAIN AND PLENIPOTENTIARY EXTRAORDINARY R. O.J. R.

PAN AMERICAN WORLD AIRWAYS SYSTEM
LATIN AMERICAN DIVISION, P.O. BOX 33II, MIAMI 31, FLORIDA
July 5, 1949
Miss. Evlyn Rachel David
3798 N.
". 12 Street
Miami, Florida
Dear Miss. David:
Ever since the days of
great sailing Clipper Ships, "crossing
the line" has been a momentous event in the life of the traveler.
American World Airways,
with its great fleet of modern Clippers of the
continues this time-honored
custom by presenting you with a memento
of this occasion, admitting you into the mighty realm of Jupiter Rex.
A certificate commemorating your crossing of the equator and signed
by the Captain of your plane is enclosed. We sincerely hope that it
brings back pleasant memories of your Pan American World Airways journey.
With the advent of larger and faster "Flying Clipper Ships" and the
inauguration of more frequent schedules,
the service of Pan American
World Airways will be constantly augmented for your convenience.
We are looking forward to the pleasure of having you with us again
in the near future.
PN: v1g
Cordially yours,
Porter Massis.
Porter Norris
Traffic Manager
Latin American Division
The System of the Flying Clippers
properties.sfomuseum:description: a. Souvenir flight certificate issued by Pan American World Airways to stewardess Evelyn David, commemorating equatorial crossing from Miami, Florida to Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, June 7, 1949; contains full color illustration with printed proclamation, “From the illimitable vastness of the hyperterrestrial firmament, the empyrean realm of Jupiter Rex [...]”; gold and red ribbon seal adhered to certificate at lower left.b. Matching souvenir membership card issued to Evelyn David.c. Typed correspondence from traffic manager Porter Norris, Latin American Division, enclosed with certificate.
properties.wof:name: souvenir certificate: Pan American World Airways, Evelyn David
